A

APIData - Class in com.example.lab3_restapi
This class encapsulate all the data coming from the OpenWeather JSON API and provide access to each of the three different forecast types used in the app : live, hourly (24h) and 7-day forecast.
APIData(JSONObject, String) - Constructor for class com.example.lab3_restapi.APIData
Default constructor to initialize the JSON parsing of weather data.
APIData.WeatherData - Class in com.example.lab3_restapi
This class stores the forecast information like temperature, wind, etc.

city - Variable in class com.example.lab3_restapi.APIData.WeatherData

createFragment(int) - Method in class com.example.lab3_restapi.fragments.WeatherCollectionAdapter
Inherited method to create a new fragment for the ViewPager2.
CREATOR - Variable in class com.example.lab3_restapi.APIData.WeatherData
From the android reference : Interface that must be implemented and provided as a public CREATOR field that generates instances of your Parcelable class from a Parcel.

FetchData - Class in com.example.lab3_restapi
This class acts as the intermediary between the OpenWeather API and the app for handling requests.

Retrieve the user's city for which to fetch weather forecasts.

getCitySuggestions(Context, String) - Static method in class com.example.lab3_restapi.FetchData
Provide up to five matches from the Geocoder library for the location provided (useful if user misspells the name of the location for example).

Data for the Today tab with one forecast per hour.

getMaxHourlyForecast() - Method in class com.example.lab3_restapi.UserPreferences
Retrieve the limit for the number of hourly forecast displayed in the Today tab.

Retrieve the duration between two calls to the API for new data.
